title: Bug 49890 - Nio Selector issue on Linux platform
description:
Bug 49890 - Nio Selector issue on Linux platform
Created attachment 25997 [details]NioEndpoint.java and simple web application.
Sometimes, the server's CPU reaches 100%, and it stays at 100% all the time until the server is restarted.
Reproduced with Java versions: 1.6.007, 1.6.018, 1.6.021.
It is a duplicate of issue: Bug 46373.
It seems that the Jetty team fixed that problem: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel.
I added some logging to NioEndpoint.java.
OB: Server's CPU usage reaches 100% and remains at 100% until server restart.
EB: The expected behavior is that the server's CPU usage should not reach 100%, and normal operation should be maintained without the need for a server restart.
SR:
To reproduce the JVM bug, perform the following steps:
1. Send several requests to the web application (e.g., press F5 in the browser and hold the button).
2. Observe the server's CPU usage reaching 100%.
